analysis_metadata.methodology: Quality of Earnings Analysis with Overlay Adjustments

normalization_components.name: Marketing Normalization
normalization_components.description: Normalize marketing expense to industry benchmark (10% of revenue)
normalization_components.rationale: Marketing expense dropped 93% from 2022 to 2024 (499,291 → 37,261), likely due to reclassification. Industry benchmark: 10% of revenue.

normalization_components.name: Interest Reclassification
normalization_components.description: Reclassify interest expense from operating to below-the-line
normalization_components.rationale: Interest expense should be treated as financing cost, not operating expense. Add back to normalize operating performance.

normalization_components.name: Repairs & Maintenance Normalization
normalization_components.description: Normalize R&M to 3-year average to smooth lumpy expenses
normalization_components.rationale: R&M shows significant volatility (164,053 → 44,713). Normalize to 3-year average of $84,071 for run-rate analysis.

normalization_components.name: Owner Compensation Normalization
normalization_components.description: Normalize owner compensation to market rate for similar role
normalization_components.rationale: Total payroll decreased from $1,217,000 to $967,000. Estimated excess owner compensation above $400,000 market rate.

normalization_components.name: Equipment Rental Discontinuation
normalization_components.description: Equipment rental ceased in 2023 - assess if recurring
normalization_components.rationale: Equipment rental ($17K) stopped in 2023. If this represents ongoing operational savings, no adjustment needed. If temporary, should normalize.

normalization_components.name: Asset Sale Gain (Below Line)
normalization_components.description: One-time asset sale gain - already below operating income
normalization_components.rationale: Asset sale gain of $42K in 2024 is already treated below operating income line.
